JUSTICE B.KEMATL PASHA MONDAY, THE 1ST DAY OF AUGUST 2016/10TH SRAVANA, 1938 Cr1.MC.No. 4239 of 2016 Cc 1230/2015 of JUDUCUAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT-1,KANNUR PETITIONER (S) /ACCUSED: 1. STATE OF KERALA REPRESENTED BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM- 682031. 2. MASNA C.K AGED 24 YEARS, D/O SAKKARIYA E. CHOOTTUKADAN HOUSE, KAPPAKKADAVU, AZHEEKKAL PO, KANNUR TALUK, KANNUR DISTRICT, PIN-670009. R1 BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SMT SHEEBA. R2 BY ADV. SRI.M.SURESH KUMAR THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 01-08-2016, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: K.V. ple ae oH 2016/KER/33661 CRM(C) .NO4239/2016. APPENDIX PETITIONER (S) 'ANNEXURE ANNEXURE1: PHOTOCOPY OF THE COMPLAINT C.C.NO.1230/2015 FILED BEFORE THE JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT, 1KANNUR BY THE 2ND RESPONDENT. ANNEXURE11: AFFIDAVIT SWEARED BY THE 2ND RESPONDENT/DE-FACTO COMPLAINANT . RESPONDENT (S)' ANNEXURE NIL /TRUE COPY/ P.S.TO. JUDGE K.V. Basal 2016/KER/33661 B. KEMAL PASHA, J. ar Peer aa ORDER Petitioners are the accused in C.C.No.1230/2015 before the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court-l, Kannur, registered for the offence punishable under Section 498A read with Section 34 of the Indian Penal Code. 2. Petitioners have come up with this Crl.M.C. under Section 482 CrPC. for getting Annexure-| complaint in C.C.No.1230/2015 before the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court-l, Kannur and all further proceedings based on it, quashed. 3. The allegation against the petitioners is that they have tortured and harassed the defacto complainant, who is the wife of the 1* accused, and treated her with cruelty within the meaning of Section 498A IPC, by demanding more dowry, after misappropriating her entire gold Basal 2016/KER/33661 CRL.M.C.No. 4239 of 2016 uoe ornaments and money, 4. Heard learned counsel for the petitioners, the learned counsel for the defacto complainant, who is the 2" respondent herein, and the learned Public Prosecutor. 5. According to the petitioners, all the matters in dispute between the petitioners and the defacto complainant have been amicably settled and presently the defacto complainant has no complaint against the petitioners and, therefore, the proceedings against the petitioners may be quashed. 6. The defacto complainant, who is the 2" respondent herein, has filed an affidavit affirming that all the matiers in dispute between her and the petitioners have been amicably settled and, therefore, she has no complaint against the petitioners, and, hence, all further proceedings in the matter referred to above can be quashed. She has entered appearance through her counsel. The learned counsel for the defacto complainant also endorses the fact LEER 2016/KER/33661 CRL.M.C.No. 4239 of 2016 uae that the affidavit has been sworn in by the defacto complainant on her own volition. Therefore, it is only just and expedient in the interest of justice to quash the proceedings referred to above. In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed and Annexure-l complaint in C.C.No.1230/2015 before the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court-l, Kannur, and all further proceedings in C.C.No.1230/2015, as against the petitioners herein, are hereby quashed. Sd/- B. KEMAL PASHA, JUDGE. ul/- /{ true copy // PS. to Judge.
